alert.note: Alert for Cooke (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 11:00PM CDT until May 19 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Cooke, Fannin and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sherman, Gainesville, Bonham, Whitesboro, Denison, Van Alstyne, Howe, Pottsboro, Honey Grove, Collinsville, Whitewright, Gunter, Bells, Tom Bean, Savoy, Ector, Dodd City, Callisburg, Knollwood and Ravenna.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
